posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: hello! my frc team is heaving problems in gyro drift. our robot create a drift when he rotate. Someone can help? thanks

posts.name: Pedro Braga
posts.cooked:
A good first step is to check your gyro positioning. If it is close to any motors or power wires, the magnetic field may cause interference.

Also, what are you using as your gyroscope? Knowing the model may help with troubleshooting.

Inclusive, o que que você tá usando como giroscópio? Sabendo o modelo fica mais fácil de identificar o problema.

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked:
We are currently using pigeon 2.0, close to the elevator motors as in the image below. Do you think this is what could be causing the drift?

Screenshot_20250619-140432 720×1612 93.2 KB

Screenshot_20250619-140432 720×1612 93.2 KB

Screenshot_20250619-140432 720×1612 93.2 KB

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: the pigeon is down near the center of the robot

posts.name: Aditya Naravane
posts.cooked: Did you let the robot sit still for 10-20 seconds after booting? Sometimes the gyro will be calibrating and that can cause drift I think.

I would run the calibration laid out in the user manual and see if that fixes anything. If the drift still persists, it may be worth either trying to move the gyro or contact ctre support if it’s bad enough.

Here’s the link to the page with the user manual: Pigeon 2.0

posts.name: Pedro Braga
posts.cooked: The Pigeon 2.0 advertises really low drift even without standing still at boot. Besides, after you turn on the robot, there is usually at least one minute where the Rio and radio are still turning on and connecting, so there is usually not a lot of movement.

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked: Vibration can stop the required no motion calibration.   I helped a team at competition who’s Pigeon 2 would constantly drift even while the bot was sitting still.  We plotted no motion calibration in Phoenix Tuner and saw it was never happening.   The pi stack fans were vibrating the belly pan and preventing the no motion calibration and creating a steady drift.   Unplugging the fans allowed the calibration to happen and the pigeon to achieve its usual performance.  Their fix at comp was to being the bot up then plug in the fans before leaving the field.
